alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 11:39PM PST until January 13 at 5:33AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Heavy rain has come to an end, with these rivers continuing to gradually recede through Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occuring and will continue tonight. * WHERE...Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12000.0 cfs, the Snoqualmie River will spill over its banks between the town of Snoqualmie and Fall City...covering pasture lands and several roads along the river. This river level on the Snoqualmie corresponds roughly to a phase 2 flood in the King County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM PST Wednesday the flow was 18500.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 3590.7 cfs late Saturday evening. - Flood flow is 20000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16400.0 cfs on 10/01/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 545 AM PST.
